title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.31 | 17-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Mirandasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chaksharunmilitham Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namao Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadhadhara Srivasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 31st verse of the 15th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Vishoko Brahma Sampradaya
Sanchinna Dvaita Samshayaha
Leena Prakriti Nair Gunyat
Alingatvat Asambhavaha
The meaning of this verse is
Because of his possessing spiritual assets
the doubts of duality were completely cut off.
Thus he was freed from the three modes of material nature
and placed in transcendence.
There was no longer any chance of his becoming entangled
in birth and death for he was freed from material form.
This is Suta Goswami describing the position of Arjuna.
Don't think Arjuna was lamenting after Krishna's disappearance
and he was suffering like a ordinary person feels pain and suffering
due to separation from some beloved departed soul.
soul no it's not like that so that is explained here arjuna is having those instructions in his
heart which krishna imparted and that is a spiritual asset and those spiritual assets
are useful to cut off all kinds of doubts of duality and immediately such spiritual asset
places one on the transcendental platform above the three modes of material nature
so then there is no question of becoming entangled in birth and death
so sri la prabhupada explains this in the purport doubts of duality begin from the
misconception of the material body which is accepted as a self by less intelligent persons
this material existence is
characterized by the fact that the material body is a self and the self is not a self
and the self is not a self and the self is not a self and the self is not a self and the self is not a self and the self is not a self

this material existence is characterized by dvandva duality and this duality is only because i am spirit soul or each person individual person is spirit soul but wrongly one forgets wrongly one thinks that i am this material body and forgets that i am spirit soul i am not the body the most foolish part of our ignorance is our
identifying with this material body as the cell this is the most foolish part
you are thinking something you are without knowing that it is not you just
like I think I am this body now if I think I'm this body I think I'm made up
of this flesh and blood and bones and and so many material parts of the body
and this body's becoming old and the body sometimes become sick and the body
is becoming dirty and the body is having some possessions some relationships and
I'm trying to secure them
so all because of the misidentification wrong understanding everything in
relation with the body is ignorantly accepted as our own it begins with I I

body is mine my father my mother my car my house my prestige

similar illusory contemplations
cause bewilderment for the conditioned soul everyone in this material world who's
having such wrong conceptions are bewildered bewildered everyone is
bewildered no exception even the most prosperous materialist even the

the most powerful devata everyone is bewildered by this conception of mine mine mine mine mine
now Srila Prabhupada says what is the remedy for this by assimilating the instructions
of the Bhagavad Gita one is sure to be released from such bewilderment because real knowledge
is knowledge that the Supreme Personality of Godhead Vasudeva or Lord Krishna is everything
including oneself Krishna is everything Krishna is everything means Krishna is there and his

is material energy we are his marginal energy so Krishna is everything because non-difference
between him and his energies energies are his everything is a manifestation of his potency
as part and parcel potency means his energy his Shakti so everything that we see in the

un-xaṁepa
Iman, Krishna, Krishna and Shakti, Shakti, Shakti, Iman, they are not different. So, the conception of duality is at once mitigated by attainment of perfect knowledge.
Like, I think something is mine and something else is somebody else's. But the reality is, what I think is mine is not mine, it is Krishna's.
And what I think is somebody else's is not that person's property, it is actually Krishna's.
So, this duality is completely eradicated by perfect knowledge.
Everything belongs to Krishna.
As soon as Arjuna took up the instructions of the Bhagavad Gita, expert as he was, he could at once eradicate the material conception of Lord Krishna, his eternal friend.
Material conception is, let's say, somebody has got his father and the father is his son.
And when the father dies, then he feels very sad.
My father passed away. My father is no more.
This is a material conception.
Father is no more means the body, material body, which is not the real person, not the real father, is no more.
The spirit soul has no death, has no birth, doesn't belong to this world.
So, therefore, the instructions of the Bhagavad Gita eradicate all kinds of material conceptions.
So, Arjuna could realize that the Lord was still present before him by his instruction, by his form, by his pastimes, by his qualities and everything else related to him.
Consider this, that Krishna is always present in the form of his instructions.
Eternally, those instructions are true.
So, if Krishna is present, where is the cause for lamentation that Krishna passed away, Krishna disappeared, Krishna went away to his personal abode?
No, Krishna is present.
He is present in one form, yet another form, yet another form, unlimited form.
Unlimited forms.
Krishna is always present.
So, in a sense, the devotee never feels absence of Krishna if a devotee is Krishna conscious.
So, Arjuna could realize that Lord Krishna, his friend, was still present before him by his transcendental presence in different non-dual energies.
All energies are Krishna's.
So, in the form of energy, Krishna is present.
And there is no question of attainment of the association of the Lord by another change of body under the influence of time and space.
Just like sometimes people ask that I lost my father.
And you say my father has gone to some other body.
Can I actually again associate with my father, whom I am missing, by myself taking another body like he has taken?
Because our conception of existence in the material world is simply based on body.
That's all.
But the truth is, this body is simply some...
material form.
Temporary material form.
It has nothing to do with the real person, the spirit soul.
The spirit soul has got spiritual identity, which is eternal.
The material form is simply a dress, a covering, a...
a form, a...
a material...
object.
It has no life...
by itself.
Material form has no life by itself.
Whereas the spiritual identity is ever-present.
Eternally present.
In eternal platform.
Spiritual platform.
In spiritual form.
In spiritual relationship with Krishna.
Eternally present.
So therefore, Prabhupada concludes by telling,
by attainment of absolute knowledge,
one can be in association with the Lord constantly,
even in this present life.
How?
Simply by hearing, chanting, thinking of and worshipping the Supreme Lord.
What is true for Arjuna,
is true for everyone at all times.
Even now,
if we chant constantly Krishna's holy name,
Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare,
Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare,
we should understand and should realize this fact,
that Krishna is appearing in the form of that holy name,
transcendental sound on my tongue.
And if I hear,
Krishna is entering,
as the transcendental sound within,
through my ears, and
He can enter my heart and
touch my soul.
Touch me.
He means my soul.
And then, I immediately feel
the...
loving
presence
of Krishna.
The soothing touch of Krishna.
And this is a fact.
This is not some kind of
sentiment,
or some...
some material
adjustment in the mind.
No.
It is
a transcendental truth.
One can see Him,
one can feel His presence,
even in this present life,
simply by understanding the
Advayagyana Lord,
or the Absolute Lord,
through the process of devotional service.
You perform devotional service,
beginning with hearing and chanting,
about Krishna,
and then,
the
Advayagyana Lord,
the Absolute Lord,
will reveal Himself to you,
within your heart,
and you will never feel His absence
under any circumstances.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
